page.title: 13King's School - Activities.
page.content: Rugby, hockey and cricket are the School's principal sports. However, teams also participate in basketball, fencing, shooting, squash and swimming. Athletics and cross country are becoming increasingly popular. The School has a total of 34 acres of playing fields, as well as two squash courts, 9 tennis courts, and a hard-play area. Hobbies and interests include bridge, chess, canoeing, electronics, horticulture, judo, photography and printing. Music and drama are very important activities, and a play is produced each term in the School's 211-seat theatre. At Christmas 1983, the School performed the first ever amateur production of the musical, "Goodbye, Mr. Chips".
